org.spongepowered.api.text

Class TextTemplate

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.spongepowered.api.text.TextTemplate
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Iterable<Object>, TextElement, TextRepresentable

    public final class TextTemplate
extends Object
implements TextRepresentable, Iterable<Object>
    Represents a re-usable template that produces a formatted Text.Builder. Elements will be appended to the result builder in the order that they are specified in of(Object...).

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  TextTemplate.Arg
      Represents a variable element within a TextTemplate.

      • concat

        public TextTemplate concat(TextTemplate other)
        Concatenates the specified TextTemplate to this template and returns the result. In the event that the two templates' open/close argument containers vary, this template's argument containers will be used.
        Parameters:
        other - To concatenate
        Returns:
        Concatenated template

      • apply

        public Text.Builder apply()

        Returns:
        Text builder containing result
        Throws:
        TextTemplateArgumentException - if required parameters are missing

      • of

        public static TextTemplate of(String openArg,
                              String closeArg,
                              Object[] elements)
        Constructs a new TextTemplate for the given elements. The order of the elements is the order in which they will be appended to the result builder via apply(Map).

        The provided elements may be of any type.

        In the case that an element is a TextElement, TextElement.applyTo(Text.Builder) will be used to append the element to the builder.

        In the case that an element is an TextTemplate.Arg the argument will be replaced with the TextElement provided by the corresponding parameter supplied by apply(Map)

        In the case that an element is any other type, the parameter value's Object.toString() method will be used to create a Text object.

        Parameters:
        elements - Elements to append to builder
        openArg - String to use for beginning of Arg containers
        closeArg - String to use for end of Arg containers
        Returns:
        Newly constructed TextTemplate

      • of

        public static TextTemplate of(Object... elements)
        Constructs a new TextTemplate for the given elements. The order of the elements is the order in which they will be appended to the result builder via apply(Map).

        The provided elements may be of any type.

        In the case that an element is a TextElement, TextElement.applyTo(Text.Builder) will be used to append the element to the builder.

        In the case that an element is an TextTemplate.Arg the argument will be replaced with the TextElement provided by the corresponding parameter supplied by apply(Map)

        In the case that an element is any other type, the parameter value's Object.toString() method will be used to create a Text object.

        Parameters:
        elements - Elements to append to builder
        Returns:
        Newly constructed TextTemplate

      • arg

        public static TextTemplate.Arg.Builder arg(String name)
        Constructs a new TextTemplate.Arg to be supplied to of(Object...). This argument expects a TextElement parameter.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        argument builder

      • toText

        public Text toText()
        Description copied from interface: TextRepresentable
        Gets the textual representation of this instance for its usage in other Text objects. This may but does not need to include hover texts or other actions. This method is basically the toString() equivalent for Texts.
        Specified by:
        toText in interface TextRepresentable
        Returns:
        The text instance representing this instance
